title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message:
Hi Team,

Received a Macbook Pro with board 820-3476.  The green light turns on and then turns orange, but the fan does not spin.  I checked ppbus_g3h and i get 12.58v.  Can someone advice me further to trouble shoot this board.  Thanks.

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message: work your way through the power rails see which one is missing

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message: Thanks. Checked all power rails however, PP3V3_S3,PP3V3_S0, and PP3V3_S4 aren't present. Any further troubleshooting tips?

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message:
what is resistance to gnd on  PP3V3_S4

Check u8000 r8000

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message: The resistance to ground on PP3v3_s4 is 8.70 k ohms.  I checked R8000 and on Pin 2 - PP3v3_s4 is showing 8.70 k ohms.  I am measuring resistance to ground by putting the Red probe to ground and black probe to the test point.  Correct me if i am wrong in measuring resistance to ground.  Please advice further. Thanks.

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message: The usual U6100 termination resistor/traces, U1950, U1900, etc. How many times?

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message: Checked U6100, U1950, and U1900. Only U1900 has some mild corrosion but, only on unconnected and ground pins. U6100 and U1950 are fine. However, power rails PP5V_S4 and PP3V3_S4 are missing. On further investigation, U8020 was found to be getting hot. Can you please advice for further investigation?

title: 820-3476 - Green light but no fan spin
message: So why would U8020 get hot? Must be a short on 3v3_sus
